required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness of a Physiotherapy Treatment for Temporomandibular Hyperlaxity
clinical_study.official_title: Effectiveness of a Physiotherapy Treatment for Temporomandibular Hyperlaxity: a Case Report.

brief_summary.textblock: A 14-day physiotherapy treatment for temporomandibular joint hyperlaxity is established. Pre-intervention measurements and intermediate and end-of-treatment measurements are taken. Range of movement, algometry and muscle balance are assessed.

primary_outcome.description: The range of movement in the temporomandibular joint is assessed.
Pain in the temporomandibular artiuclation measured with an algometer and VAS is assessed.
The strength of the temporomandibular joint musculature measured with an algometer is assessed.

intervention.description: A treatment plan is carried out which aims to improve pain, muscle balance and range of motion of the temporomandibular joint.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Woman with temporomandicular joint pain for six months and diagnosed with hyperlaxity in the joint.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Men
- No temporomandibular joint pain or hyperlaxity
